Description: Body sherd of Clazomenian black-figured pottery closed vessel, probably neck-amphora; glaze fired red-brown; exterior: female figure to right (back of head with tresses, chest and shoulder remaining).
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Sir William Matthew Flinders Petrie
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Museum of Fine Arts, Boston. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Unlike most representations of women on Clazomenian black-figure vases, the figure on this sherd does not have added white for flesh.
Bibliographic references: Robinson 1893 / Catalogue of Greek, Etruscan and Roman Vases (p. 239, no. 255)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GH.100) (phase 3)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Museum of Fine Arts, Boston
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: P.5966 (Pottery & Porcelain Ledger No.)
